metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32250 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing ofSMB2_SESSION_SETUP commands. The issue results from the lack of properlocking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leveragethis vulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
